meanings.definition: The emission of radiation, especially light, by actinic substances.
meanings.sent1: The actinisms from the glowing chemicals lit up the dark room.
meanings.sent2: Photographers use special filters to capture actinisms in their photos.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the lamp, creating actinisms all over the floor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like actinisms, brightening up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks painted the sky with actinisms of color.

meanings.definition: The property of being sensitive to light, especially in photography.
meanings.sent1: His camera settings were adjusted to enhance the actinisms in the picture.
meanings.sent2: The film used in old cameras had a high level of actinisms.
meanings.sent3: The photographer's eyes had actinisms, allowing him to see clearly in the dark.
meanings.sent4: Her skin had a natural actinisms, making her glow in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflected the actinisms of the setting sun.

meanings.definition: The process of producing chemical changes in a photographic emulsion by exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: The actinisms on the film created a beautiful image.
meanings.sent2: Developing photos involves controlling the actinisms on the film.
meanings.sent3: The accidental actinisms on the film resulted in a unique picture.
meanings.sent4: Her memories were captured in the actinisms of the photographs.
meanings.sent5: The actinisms on the film revealed hidden details in the picture.
